title: Let us get "Essence capsules" when we get S+ or S
body:
Let us get "Essence capsules" along with hextech chest and a key when we get S+ or S

Essence capsule should contain OE / BE.

replies.body: And let us NOT get chests with just a tiny bit of BE or one shard of a shitty champion when we get an S grade.

A few issues here, that I can see.

* It's *more free stuff*. That sounds great, but Riot already gives out a lot of free stuff, and, bluntly, they aren't a charity.
* It makes *not* getting an S into much more of a penalty, as there's a limit to the number of chests you can get per-champion and per-season, so if you miss one you can make it up later. This doesn't have that, so missing out is just essence lost.
* It further encourages players to play for the rating, not for the game.

Trust me, friend, I get your point. But now, listen to mine: runes have always been free. They have NEVER costed RP, and considering they were a major point of gameplay, it was a good thing they were available with IP. Plain and simple, runes don't count. Champions have always been free, they also have never relied on RP prices. Both these items are gameplay-reliant, hence why they aren't microtransaction-reliant.

Hextech crafting is where Riot's generosity gets iffy for me. Due to the current system we have, lots of players have an inbalance in loot. Plenty of chests but no keys, or even the rare no chests but plenty of keys. Even when disregarding this problem, it takes a crazy amount of orange essence to enchant skin shards in comparison to how much you disenchant them for. What I want is not free things per say, what I want is an equal and fair hextech crafting system. Either that, or just remove it all together. The Pizza Delivery Sivir skin shard disenchants for 270 OE, but enchants for 1050. It's almost 4x the cost. 3.8 to be exact.

So not only are chests increasingly harder to even open, but even when you do open them, there is little chance you will be rewarded with anything. There are very few legendary skins and even fewer ultimate skins. Compared to the 700+ other skins in the RNG, these "premium cosmetics" you spoke of in your reply are few and far inbetween. I'm not asking for anything crazy like a free skin a week, I'm asking for a fair system. 

To be honest, I don't even really care for the suggestion the OP gave, but I do disagree with the fact that Riot gives us tons of free stuff. This isn't a "small indie company" anymore, it's a multi-billion dollar company owned by the biggest game investor in the world.


TLDR: Fix the Hextech crafting system ratios, literally all we need.
I can get behind that.

Compare how much stuff you can get for free, and the rate at which you can get free stuff in League of Legends.  Now compare it to another game like hearthstone.  see any big differences?

in league, you can get for free:
-champions (at a decently slow rate but its not that slow)
-skins (3 promotional free skins + rerolling skin shards, which no one seems to do even though you can get good skins from it)
-you can actually play something that is meta without spending money

now take hearthstone
-you can get enough gold for one pack without quests through 30 wins (sped up slightly by quests but only one a day)
-All alternate heroes (basically skins) cost money with just a few being free promotional stuff
**-pay to win players have a pretty big advantage over f2p players (this applies to almost all other free games that actually try to make money)
**

Riot gives more for free than you want to admit, and you know it.  They already have a higher earning rate for the free currency, and **spending money does not give you gameplay advantages, just cosmetics and maybe extra champions that your probably dont even need  
**  If Riot was to be like other companies, they would give you zero skins for free, make you spend money for runes, or even make certain items only unlockable with money.  However, Riot is not like other companies, and gives the people who spend money only cosmetics, and no impact on the gameplay itself.  Riot is already doing the playerbase a huge favor by NOT being like other companies and make us spend money for gameplay advantages.

Honestly Riot spoils us too much to the point where people are begging for more when other companies dont even give as much as Riot.

So you're allowed a whole total of 4 chests, gaining one chest per week after obtaining one, and then have to wait on key shards that have a disgustingly low drop rate.
Add in as well, even after cramming on a champion _you don't play_ to finally earn a Hextech Chest, it's not even the Masterwork chest, so chances are you'll end up with a Champion Shard. Wow!
